acts of gather https://t.co/BGRhSJCYLR

@BeardedSteven I just realised about Winston. My heart can hardly even go there, sending you lots of â™¥ï¸. When @northseacrashes met my dog she said that Winston & all your dogs had opened her to them which is a impact for him to have had. Take care
@Monsterlander Are the objections to the ashes specifically?

@Monsterlander That's interesting, I didn't know it was possible to do that. It felt significant to have the conversation but I don't know why really. I've just written about public/private acts of grief so would have liked to have known this before I submitted!
So yeah, ask people their name.
And now I wonder who they were & if I imagined it.

they went to find the cave they lived in with a Sadhu in the 60's but the cave was now a road bridge. Then they chanced upon someone who knew where the Sadhu was & went & met them deep in the mountains.

I was in Hebden Bridge a few months ago, & I got talking in the street to someone who had just been to India to scatter their dog's ashes at the dog's request & as they were going anyway took the ashes of a friend's partner who had always wanted to go to India. Whilst they were

@ofthesparrows Not yet, I've still not reached the ones from nearer the start (had so many & have been dipping in & out) . Planning on doing more tonight & tomorrow so will do v soon though

RT @dobraszczyk: Heartfelt thanks from me to @Archieislander and 22 others, including @peterkalu @SarahButler100 @matthewgsteele @thelrm @Mâ€¦
@journeymanhisto @ManchesterUP @dobraszczyk @SarahButler100 Thanks, David. I am the non Mancunian, non Manchester residing, non academic interloper so interesting angle to approach from!

Pleased to have had it confirmed that I'll be contributing 3 chapters to a book on architecture & the imagination in Manchester to be published by @ManchesterUP in 2020 as Manchester: Something Rich and Strange ed @dobraszczyk @SarahButler100
